review.title: Great location in San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
Zeta is not a mega hotel. This makes you feel more like a guest and not a number. Front desk personnel seem to remember names quite well and always ask how they may help you find your way around the city. This was our first time in San Francisco so we were always asking for information which they gladly gave. 
Our room with a king bed was adequate for 2 adults. Large bathroom. We were surprised and grateful to experience how quiet our room was. No hallway noise or noise between rooms.
The only issue we had was with the area rug in the main room area. It bunched up and, if not careful, could become a tripping hazard. I hope they will fix this.
We would surely stay here again on our next visit.
review.locationRemarks: Zeta is within a short walk to Union Square, a transportation hub. Also, nearby to a cable car turn around on Powell St.

review.title: Good choice hotel for visitors to San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a great location for daytime activities.  The lobby, bar and games area are very stylish.  The rooms are not bad, if a little dark if you get put on the wrong side of the building.  We were given an option of two rooms as there were four of us including two kids and the first room was light but too small so we opted for the larger room which didn't have much sunlight but as we weren't planning on staying in the room except to sleep we opted for the larger space.
We weren't given any assistance getting all our bags out of the cab which was a bit of a poor first impression but after that the staff were great.  
The location is great for tourists as you are close to transport; subways, trams and buses and right in Market Street which is the main route down to the waterfront and all the attractions down there.
At night the local area it is a bit sketchy as my SF cousins called but really it's fine if you stay aware and don't turn down the wrong street.  Plus my advice would be to use Uber after dark anyway.
review.positiveRemarks: Cool hotel with good transport links to everything you would want to see in this city.
review.locationRemarks: See above plus the Westield shopping centre directly next door is huge with all the top brand stores.

review.title: Perfect location.
review.reviewText: This hotel is right next to the Westfield Mall. You can take the BART in from SFO and walk less than a block to the hotel. It is also very close to union square. Rooms are comfortable with free wi-fi. Front desk was great at check in and check out the second floor game room. Highly recommended.

review.title: Stylish hotel with easy access to everything
review.reviewText: This hotel was decorated in a quirky, modern style. Really great vibe with a small bar in the lobby, could be kid friendly with a large game room (also great for the kid-at-heart). Don't let that "kid friendly" scare you away though because I only saw 1 child while I was visiting. Rooms were spacious enough, again with the modern decor, I really loved it. We had some issues working the AC but opened a window and that took care of everything. The staff was mostly very friendly, 1 woman seemed to have a bit of an attitude on the 2 occasions I saw her but nothing that would cause me not to return. The location is very close to the BART which is convenient for the airport, and walkable to many bars, restaurants, even the ferry building is a short 1 mile. I didn't mind walking anywhere in the city though because there's almost always a view or something to look at and its very temperate. Overall great experience at Hotel Zetta, would definitely recommend!

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText:
PROS:  Our corner room was on a high floor and was quite comfortable... large bathroom with big shower, nice bed and bedding, bright and quiet for a city hotel.  We had a couple breakfasts and a dinner in the restaurant which, though not gourmet, was just fine.  The location was excellent -- close to other hotels that are far more expensive.  The staff was pleasant and efficient.  I thought Hotel Zetta offered great value -- it's a clean, modern hotel.

CONS:  The only con was the neighborhood... one block and you're in the heart of the city, one block the other way and the neighborhood is slowly "gentrifying" but still full of homeless and addicts.  We used Uber to get around so we didn't have to wander far, but be forewarned.  San Fran has a terrible homeless problem (not the hotel's fault!)
review.negativeRemarks: Our only complaint was they charged us for high speed wifi by accident, but they quickly removed it from the bill.

Please feel free to call me when your travels bring you back into San Francisco, I look forward to speaking with you and exceeding your expectations!

Best,

Sean 
Assistant Rooms Manager

review.title: Good location for shopping
review.reviewText: A couple hiccups at first with a room that smelled terribly of mildew. Cool vibe in the hotel, but the beautiful bar should be open during the day.  The finishes are starting to show some wear, with seams coming apart in the carpet in our room and lobby floor needing to be refinished. Also lack of late check out was lame. Overall a great location and nice place to stay but it did not reach its awesome potential. Had a nice time in the hotel restaurant.

review.title: Awesome location and staff
review.reviewText: Stayed 3 nights, great large room with 2 queen beds. Facilities fantastic & staff go out of their way to help you. Funky hotel for those who don't want your average boring corporate hotel. Loved it, wish we were staying longer!

review.title: It's ok
review.reviewText:
The location, the lobby and the 2nd floor are great. 

However , getting your room cleaned and serviced by house keeping is a complete nightmare.  
In 4 days they never set foot in my room to change towels or sheets.  Called and requested twice that house keeping come to the room, never showed up.   Not sure if the front desk person never called house keeping or what.  

I wouldn't stay there again.  Lots of nice hotels in the SF area.

review.title: Great location, ok stay.
review.reviewText: No microwave capability at all (for warming baby food). Cleaning service left window open with AC on, room was VERY warm, took a long time to cool down.

review.title: Boutique San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText:
Quirky, comfortable and friendly hotel. Our room was bright and reasonably spacious, and although it had no view it was quiet and the bed was comfortable. It was my wife's birthday and the Duty Manager kindly sent a bottle of wine and chocolates to the room - a lovely gesture, and totally unexpected. Thank you!

The room was well equipped and toiletries of a decent standard. The fridge was suitably stocked, if a bit pricey - but probably no more expensive than elsewhere in the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent, helpful and friendly staff. Quirky touches (see the street art graffiti down both stairwells).
review.negativeRemarks: It's good just the way it is.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for Powell Street, Cable Cars, Union Square.

review.title: Good hotel and very close to Market & Powell Sts.
review.reviewText: Close to everything that we wanted to access e.g. cable car, trolley car & train station. Good shopping centre next door (Westfield) and some great cafes and restaurants for breakfast and dinner on 5th Street.

review.title: Recommended!
review.reviewText:
Great location, clean rooms, quiet.
There's a great little cafe nearby with Bluebottle Coffee - perfect for mornings!
Valet is expensive $55/day but it's SF and standard.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great. Modern, comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: More people at the checkin.
review.locationRemarks: Steps away from shopping, restaurants, galleries.

review.reviewText: Very good facilities and clean with friendly staff. Som rooms can be a little dark due to location and surrounding buildings.

review.title: Well placed in the city
review.reviewText: Fun,  carefree,  helpful staff,  and amazing location

review.title: Nice hotel. View of a wall from most rooms
review.reviewText:
I stayed here for one night. Made a point of asking for a quiet and high room. Checked into a room that looked into a wall with a window. I asked to be changed and got a tour of 3 other rooms that looked directly onto walls. The decor is nice and beds comfy but you feel like you are in a shoe box. 
It's a good place to stay if you don't want to hang out in the room and just use it to sleep.

review.title: Fun hotel
review.reviewText: Great weekend celebrating our daughter's 20th birthday!  Staff was very helpful with directions and ideas for restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: The vibe of the hotel is laid back green with an artsy edge. Enjoyed playing shuffleboard with our children. In the game room upstairs.
review.negativeRemarks: Be sure stored luggage makes it to the room before we do!
review.locationRemarks: Walked to China town to get fresh sesame rolls.  Ate a fantastic dinner at Ember.  Drove everywhere else. (Academy of Science, Japan town for parade).

review.title: Great stay perfect location to explore
review.reviewText: What a great funky arty hotel smack in the centre of San Fransisco.  The staff could not do enough to help and provided everything I needed for my short 4 day stay.  Helpful drivers and front desk.  The restaurant was lively and a great bar to hang out in and eat fresh seasonal food.  It was perfect and I will go back again in the future. Thanks

review.title: Great location , cool vibe
review.reviewText:
Location is great , excellent facilities , cool recreation room to hang out with wide range of options. 
Hotel has lots of interesting features throughout
Friendly staff

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText:
Right next door to the BART, adjacent to Union Square, it is ideally located.  The staff is incredibly helpful, especially with regard to organizing dinner reservations and making fantastic recommendations - my husband and I were most impressed.  The decor is interesting, modern yet personable due to the smaller size of the hotel.  The amenities provided in our room were everything anyone could want, or ask for.  The only aspect of room comfort that was challenging could only be attributed to the air-conditioning system which was very loud and every time it cut in, it woke both myself and my husband.  Had we stayed longer we would have inquired about how to mitigate the noise, if possible.
I would stay here again in spite of the annoyance of the air-conditioner!
review.positiveRemarks: Mostly liked the location as well as the uber-cool decor.  Really appreciated the large bottles of moisturizer, shampoo and conditioner!
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe we're light sleepers but I'm sure the A/C could be managed in order to have it hum rather than sound like a wind tunnel.
review.locationRemarks: Smack in the middle of downtown San Francisco - what more is there to say?

review.title: The best, friendliest staff! Very close to Union S
review.reviewText: The best, friendliest staff! Very close to Union Square

review.title: Unique Boutique
review.reviewText: Very unique small hotel with art everywhere. Cool lounge and upstairs game room. The bathroom was great. Bed was comfortable. Would give 5 stars but the truth is there are better, nicer, newer, etc. hotels in the city. I do recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Modern, lounge, game room.

review.title: Bad customer service.
review.reviewText: The hotel prides itself as being a tech hotel yet during my two night stay I had to have their electrician come to my room twice to either replace one of the tech amenities or jimmy rig it a certain way which required additional cables that they installed for me to use my tv. On top of that they had the audacity to charge me $200 to use the cables that they gave me to use their broken services. After going back and forth with them for the past two days I call for a late check out since I need to work an additional hour andthey tell me, sorry too many people have called and we are no longer accommodating late check outs since we have a high turn around rate for new guests coming in. I asked for the manager and gave him an ear full of their customer services issues which realistically is what we are paying for first and foremost! I want a nice bed and great customer service! If you are a 4 star hotel and you tell your guests that you cannot accommodate them for an additional hour you are basically telling us that this hotel isn't equipped to handle it's job! You Are a 4 star hotel in the peak season of San Francisco this is what you guys should do best. Customer service is always first when that's what we are purchasing in the first place. 3 star hotels have great beds as well minus the service. I have stayed in many amazing hotels and this was by far the most challenging hotel I've stayed in yet. The staff had a pompous attitude and had no problem turning you away.

review.title: Chic hotel, great location...
review.reviewText: Modern boutique hotel, minutes away from Union Square. Located right next door to a big shopping centre and all the main high street shops. Good value for money.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, style
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Amazing Hotel! I didn't want to leave!! Loved it!!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at The Zetta this weekend because we were in SF to see a comedy show at The Warfield (Bo Burnham is AMAZING!! If you don't know who he is you've gotta check him out on YouTube!!). The hotel staff was SO nice! Valet overnight parking was $50, but that's the going rate at all the hotels in that area. Plus The Warfield was only a 5 minute walk from The Zetta so it was definitely worth it! The bed was super comfy & the room had a huge flat screen TV & a speaker system set up for your iPhone! The Zetta also offers FREE wi-fi unlike a lot of the other hotels in the Market/SOMA district which charge $15/night! The minibar was stocked with a large variety of beers, liquor, wine, juices, sodas, candies & snacks & the in-room espresso maker was awesome! I made late night (10:30pm!) dinner reservations online for The Cavalier (the hotels restaurant/bar) and even though the place was a little busy, the moment we walked in without asking any questions the hostess said, "You must be Ashley...right this way..."! She led us to a great corner table where we enjoyed complementary champagne (complements of the hotel) & the BEST ribeye steak I've ever had! I would make the 1.5 hour drive just to eat that steak again! So please believe me when I say, if you're not too sure where to stay in San Francisco and you're going back and forth comparing hotels (like I did!), stop right now and book a room at The Zetta! You will NOT be disappointed!

review.title: Decent location
review.reviewText: Good location for most of SF activities & excellent restaurant

review.title: All good. 95%
review.reviewText: All very good, less the less fortunate out my window at 4:00am looking throught the Garbage bin for bottles.
review.positiveRemarks: staff and location
review.negativeRemarks: Security on the back street

review.title: A couple doors down from Westfield shopping!
review.reviewText: Zetta was a great experience - literally steps from the big shopping center (same block) and near downtown shopping, cable car and more! As a thirty something - I loved that this hotel had a young and modern vibe - from the "playroom" to the staff and overall feel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, updates, friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Horribly loud vent in the room and the fan had no in-between speed - only blew at full force when on, so never a happy medium. Too hot or too cold!
review.locationRemarks: Near shopping and Walgreen's if you have forgotten anything or just need water that is not $6. Cable car a few blocks away, walking distance to cafes!

review.title: Excellent service
review.reviewText: Great customer service, thoughtful & cleverly designed rooms - loved it

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The Zetta is a fantastic little hotel very centrally located. It's very modern and has so real boutique feel. Highly recommended!
review.positiveRemarks: Atyle

review.title: Great centrally located
review.reviewText: Great place to stay when visiting the Bay Area. Trendy hotel on prime location.

review.title: Perfect location to experience the city.
review.reviewText: Great location.  Cool bar. Contemporary furnishings.  Helpful staff, especially reception and valet parking.

review.title: Excellent location!
review.reviewText: We loved this property and were pleasantly surprised that the hotel was actually better in person than is depicted in the photos on-line.  You can't beat the price, location and quality.  If you're thinking of using their valet parking, save your money and utilize the garage that's just one block away for half the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, room size, bedding quality, wifi
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco Center, Union Square, Ferry Building, convenient parking

review.title: lovely staff very helpful
review.reviewText: The hotel was very welcoming. I was there for a conference so didn't have much time to explore. San Francisco is a lovely place but quite confronting with the levels of homelessness. The street people are very polite and lovely, but it made me sad walking the streets seeing so much need
review.positiveRemarks: The staff
review.negativeRemarks: Their green program seems to mean that nothing gets done in the room (e.g. trash emptying) which was a bit frustrating, but was minor overall

review.title: Perf for Ladies Trip!
review.reviewText: We had a great experience at the Zetta. We came down for a girls trip (including one baby girl) to enjoy shopping, good food and checking out the SF scene. The location was perfect since Market Street and Union Square were just very short jaunts where there is great and plentiful high end and middle of road shopping and eats. We were also able to walk to Valencia from here (~15 minutes) to enjoy trendy boutique shopping. We also walked to Chinatown, Crooked Street and then to the Fishermen's Wharf one day from here with no problems. The hop-on, hop-off buses are nearby at Union Square to check out all of San Fran tourist hotspots and it's also easy to get on the trollies or transit as well. All of the staff we interacted with were helpful, friendly, funny and accommodating from the check-in to the concierge. The room itself was great - two queens, modern, clean, bright with good espresso and nice big bathroom and full amenities. Another great thing was the restaurant, the Cavalier, which had some of the best food we had on the whole trip... and trust me... we like good food. Great cafe in the square across the street for the mornings as well. The hotel was also baby-friendly and never caught one inadvertent scowl or insincere comments about having a baby with us. It's nice to be able to go to a trendy chic hotel and have everyone realize my baby is chic as well.

review.title: Noisy, but adequate
review.reviewText: We were in a room near the gym and the bar and it was very noisy. Our windows faced another wall of windows. The air con was too noisy to leave on. All in all, not good value for money. Staff were excellent especially Caroline at front desk.
review.positiveRemarks: See above
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: Location was ok

review.title: Heaven on earth
review.reviewText: Great hotel we had a late arrival the staff were very helpful and all through our stay very helpful. They had a man cave there my sons would have loved it very close to shops etc great location. The only negative was it was a little noisey early morning but the beds made up for it they were wonderful after a hard day sightseeing and shopping  you melted into it  at night. Bathrooms were great .
review.positiveRemarks: Everything top to bottom , very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Waited to long for a drink in the bar but found a great bar up the road and bonus happy hour
review.locationRemarks: Westfield shopping right next door and hop on hop off buses . Heaps of eating places all ranges .

review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel! Hip and clean rooms.
Helpful staff
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square

review.title: Modern boutique hotel in excellent location
review.reviewText:
Welcoming hotel. Great lobby bar. Very friendly staff. Located just round the corner from the major transport links on Market Street. Only 5 minute walk to BART, street cars and cable cars. 10 minute walk to centre of Union Square.

Rooms are small but comfortable. Full size desk. Reliable (and free) internet access. We had a room with a walk in shower which was perfect for us. Very large TV in the room.

Fun playroom on the mezanine above the bar. Play pool or a few other fun games will enjoying a beer or cocktails.

Take time to walk up the stairs for an interesting take on art!

I would highly recommend this hotel if you are planning to take a vacation in San Francisco. We stayed for 6 nights.

review.title: Great boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Great location and business stay! Close to union square with great staff.

review.title: Modern Hotel, very close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Hotel zetta is very modern and people friendly hotel. From pin ball on wall and art gallery on staircase I was impressed by it at very first glance.
When I checked in, I was given an already occupied room, but when I pointed this out, hotel staff apologised profusely and gave complementary chocolates and water bottle.
Our room was comfortable. I was impressed with illy coffee machine and smiled at thoughtfulness of the hotel staff when found an umbrella in the closet. I loved the Neil George toiletries, they were very mild with sweet fragrance. Book case wallpaper in the bathroom was the prize winner, it actually help me decide my next read!!

review.title: Good location. Close to Union Square and shopping
review.reviewText: Comfortable stay close to lots of shopping, union square and public transport.
review.positiveRemarks: Modern decor

review.title: business/ pleasure in San Fran
review.reviewText: The Zetta is a unique boutique hotel. rooms are spacious for being in the middle of the shopping district. Well appointed , updated and a bit artsy so it has more of a homey feel rather than the standard commercial hotel. Lobby Bar/ Lounge an easy hangout . Game room provides a good place to kill time in between excursions or before /after dinner. Staff friendly and very helpful.  As described by other reviews the Hotel Zetta is perfectly located. I came in for business and stayed a few days extra . This was my first visit to San Francisco and from the Zetta I walked practically everywhere. BART across the street, Cable Car across the street , 2 blocks away is Union square and bus tours of the city , Gigantic Mall next door. - Easily the spot for my next visit to SF.
review.positiveRemarks: new
review.negativeRemarks: reg coffee, not expresso  lol
review.locationRemarks: BART across the street, Cable Car across the street , 2 blocks away is Union square and bus tours of the city , Gigantic Mall next door

review.title: Nice location, but room smaller than expected.
review.reviewText: Great location. I was expecting a larger room for the Premier Studio, but it was very small, which was smaller than expected for the price. Refrigerator did not allow for outside food or drinks.

review.title: Very Central, very cool, very nice
review.reviewText: Went there with the family. The layout of the hotel, decor and theming creates a fun experience. The staff were helpful and accommodating. We all enjoyed our stay immensely.
review.positiveRemarks:
Visually, the thoughtful interior design and good choice of artwork.
Practically, the well thought through room layout and bathrooms
review.negativeRemarks: The internet connection kept interrupting me.
review.locationRemarks: It's right on Union Square – perfect.

review.title: Awesome Location for Everything
review.reviewText:
Hotel Zetta is conveniently located for doing anything in San Fran and area. It borders the Tenderloin District so can be a bit sketch at night but during the day it's awesome. Union Square and all major shopping is literally seconds away.
The hotel and rooms were exceptionally clean and everyone we encountered was very helpful.
The lobby and evening entertainment are a whole lot of fun.
I'll be back and will highly recommend it to everyone.

review.title: Trendy hotel next to Bloomingdales
review.reviewText:
Nice trendy hotel for the young professional.
It is in a great location, one block east of Market.

review.title: Stylish but expensive hotel.
review.reviewText:
Generally ok, but the room cleaning service fell below the standard experienced in other hotels. For example, the room was cleaned on the morning after our first night in the hotel but the bin was not emptied. Additionally we found our night clothes (which we had left on the bed) on top of a shopping bag we had left on the floor. In other hotels we would return to find our night clothes folded on the bed, not thrown onto a bag on the floor. 

The room was very stylishly decorated, with evidence of focus on technology. However, the technology was disappointing because although on arrival we logged into the wifi for the duration of our stay (4 nights) the access kept dropping and we had to keep re-logging in (inputting name, room number, email address and location each time). This was annoying because it is expected that once logged in (especially where you have specified the duration of your stay) you would not have to keep re-logging in, sometimes several times in one day. 

The hotel is in a good location, being about 2 minutes from the Westfield shopping centre and about 25 minutes on the bus from Fisherman's Wharf. 

Overall the hotel is good, if expensive, and was let down by a few things that could be easily addressed.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at Hotel Zetta. Such a modern hotel, rooms are amazing & comfortable. Great location & the staff at Zetta are lovely- great recommendations for eating out & site seeing!
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort & location!

review.title: Centrally located, boutique hotel with a cool vibe
review.reviewText:
Stayed for a few nights at Hotel Zetta to avoid the cookie-cutter chain hotels. The hotel offers a really cool feel, extremely professional, friendly and helpful staff, a full range of services, and modern, clean rooms. As with a lot of hotels in SF, if you're looking for an expansive room, this might not be for you -- we were supposed to have a "Premium Studio King" but  ended up with a "Superior Room" (although we didn't get a refund... nor were we notified of the change - figured it out myself when looking into reviewing the hotel...). Anyhow, it was fairly small...

The hotel is also busy (it seems) with private events -- the three nights we stayed there were two private events that prevented use of the game room and/or the bar/lounge. Given that there are dozens of places within walking distance, it doesn't really matter...

Overall it was a great stay - I'd return and recommend to friends/colleagues.
review.positiveRemarks:
- Modern look and feel
- Great lobby bar
- Staff was professional but friendly
- Rooms were clean and well-appointed
review.negativeRemarks: - List any private events in the lobby so guests know to make alternate plans (figuring out a place to go for a drink when the lobby bar is closed
review.locationRemarks:
- Westfield Mall (San Francisco Center) is next door 
- Market St.
- Ferry Terminal/Building/Embarcadero etc. about 30min walk

review.title: Exceptional staff, great vibe & perfect location
review.reviewText:
My brother and I waited till the last minute to plan our car hire to drive from San Fran to LA to make our flight back to Sydney. The staff at Hotel Zetta were so amazing at helping us find a car, and even printed out a map and instructions for our journey. 

The hotel is right next to all the shops and restaurants. So convenient and close to everything.

review.title: Very nice!
review.reviewText: Super nice and cool! And a very nice Cavalier restaurant, good food!

We had stayed at the hotel before and the staff recognized us.  They upgraded our room and gave us a complimentary bottle of wine.  A special shout-out to Odil and Benny, the desk staff personnel who made sure we had a great time.
review.positiveRemarks: The ambiance is modern and the staff make it feel like home.
review.locationRemarks: It's near Union Sq and great shopping.

review.title: Nice hotel close to great shopping.
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Don't stay on the third level above the lounge unless you don't mind a noisy room. Lots of trancient street people nearby.

review.title: Wonderful hotel close in SOMA, close to BART
review.reviewText: We had a fabulous stay at the Hotel Zetta San Francisco. Everything about the hotel was excellent from the friendly and helpful staff, to the modern and comfortable room. We loved everything. The hotel has a great lobby/bar/entertainment area that was super fun and lots of people hung out every night. Everything in the rooms was thought of from the standard things (nice toiletries, comfortable bedding, iPhone/iPad dock that connects to the TV, a Jambox that you could take out into the city with you to enjoy your music and so much more. All of the staff was helpful to tell us the best way to do things and great things that locals enjoy. Also, the hotel was super easy to get to from the airport. Just take the BART (San Francisco metro system) from the airport and the hotel is less than a block away. Can't rave enough about the Hotel Zetta San Francisco! You will love it!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything from the staff, to the rooms, to the location.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in SOMA, close to Union square and lots of public transit options nearby.

review.title: Loved the Zetta staff!
review.reviewText: We stayed over the July 4th holiday which also happened to be my husband's 50th birthday. We mentioned this at check-in and within moments of reaching our room, somebody had come up with a complimentary bottle of wine and a hand-written card from all the staff. From then on, every time we passed the front desk or bar, we were greeted like family. I have honestly never experienced this in a hotel before and I felt genuinely sad to leave. They all seem to understand how service can be warm, friendly and professional without being overbearing. We simply loved the place and will definitely go back.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved it all, but the staff made it unforgettable
review.negativeRemarks: As is often the case, prices of minibar refreshments are pretty eye-watering! But there's a great convenience store right across 5th Street
review.locationRemarks: Ideal for Market St shopping, Union Square, Powell-Hyde cable car to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: N/A
review.reviewText: Stay was great. Was not provided with Elite Plus perks on check-in but other than that, very nice boutique hotel with prime location and awesome amenities and extras.

review.title: Hip, high-end hotel in very central location
review.reviewText:
I stayed at Hotel Zetta for three days during a recent business trip. It is a hip, upscale hotel that's very clean, well managed, and is centrally located. The room was nicely laid out, the bed was extremely comfortable, and everything looked recently renovated (I think it is).

Best of all, because Hotel Zetta is an Expedia VIP Access hotel, as an Expedia Rewards Elite Plus member I got a free upgrade to a larger room with king size bed, free WiFi, and some other goodies.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice, clean, very close to Market Street hub.
review.negativeRemarks: Downstairs eatery could open earlier and stay open later.
review.locationRemarks: Extremely central location. Near metro station, very close to Moscone Center, Yerba Buena Gardens, and the Metreon. Blocks from Union Square!

review.title: 6 Days in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: What a great hotel this was...staff almost turned themselves inside out to make our stay in the windy city as comfortable as possible, take a bow CAROLINE, sorry we missed seeing u before we left but a major thank u goes ur way...trendy, chic & great vibe...close to everything as well..couldn't speak highly enough of our time there.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything...
review.negativeRemarks: Probably a little more on the menu...

review.title: Great hotel - close to transport and shopping
review.reviewText: Friendly, helpful hotel with great rooms, close to BART station and cable car turnaround and even has a free yoga class on Saturday! Felt very safe there as a woman traveller. Thoroughly recommended.
review.locationRemarks: A bus ride from the ferry building and right next door to Westfield and Union Square shopping.

review.title: Downtown base for sightseeing
review.reviewText: Great hotel, casual chic. Playroom was fun - table tennis, giant Jenga, pool etc. The room was good but the layout of the hotel meant we had another room directly opposite our windows - about 8' away - so had to leave the blinds drawn. Ask for a front room if you don't want to do this.

review.title: Easy location with interesting arts
review.reviewText: Super friendly staff, comfortable and cozy room. Great location, easy to drive and parking.

review.title: Great hotel and good location
review.reviewText:
Hotel was in a good location - next to Westfield shopping mall & round the corner you were straight onto Market Street where you can jump on the F street car to Pier 39 & Fisherman's Wharf. Also when you are on Market Street and cross the road, you can catch the cable car (in between Forever 21 and Gap). The hotel was not that far from Union Square too where you can do more shopping or grab a coffee and sit at the square.
Staff were really friendly and helpful when asking for directions, recommendations to restaurants and information about bike rental and bus tour. We stayed a week at SF and it was our first time - get 48hr bus tour ticket (will inc night tour, 3 walking tours, entry to aquarium of the bay and Sausalito tour) perfect way of seeing the sights, hire a bike and ride across the Golden Gate bridge and go on segway tour (amazing!)
Room was tidy and clean, although they were in the middle of changing the locks and moving away from the swipe card entry. Free wi-fi within hotel and room.
Also there is a games room in the hotel which looked really good and saw some people use this facility.

review.title: One of my favorites
review.reviewText: Zetta is modern and hip. Clean, quiet, and spacious. Unlike most the hotels near Moscone and Union Square you get a good sized room with a bathroom. The bar/lounge is very trendy. The Restaurant is very good though the menu is limited. The staff is very friendly. The location is right on the edge of sketchy, but not bad.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, quiet, and spacious. Unlike most the hotels near Moscone and Union Square you get a good sized room with a bathroom. The bar/lounge is very tre
review.locationRemarks: Very near market. .5 miles to Moscone or Union Square.

review.title: Well suited to business travelers.
review.reviewText:
We were going to be spending the night dancing at a place near this hotel so it was conveniently located for us. The hotel lobby has a bar in it and it was a hip little spot to drink until 11pm. Which we did. The front desk staff and the valet were on the ball and very polite. The check in process took a couple of minutes.

Heading up to our room was interesting. The Hotel is a little bit of a maze, but the signs are very clear. The rooms are all grouped together by 4 in these little alcoves. Because of this odd design the rooms look inward toward each other and there are some very clear views of the rooms across from you. We had a room that was not facing the street side, so we don't know if those rooms have more private views.

The room itself is very modern and very clean, but a little small. It had a lot of amenities that are suited to a solo business person who would be using their room for work or after hours as well. Other than the size and the views the room as very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: I love the lobby bar which was a nice place to sit and have a drink. I thought the room was very comfortable and has modern amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: There is not much they can do about it, but the room was a bit small.
review.locationRemarks: The location is very central. It is close to Market street, The Metreon and Union Square. BART is also close by.There is plenty to eat/do in the area.

review.title: Modern fun hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText:
Staff very friendly and helpful.
Good restaurant , British themed.
review.positiveRemarks: Good base for seeing the sights

review.title: Modern funky hotel in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Staff was very polite and helpful. Rooms nicely designed and very clean. Comfortable bed. Neat contemporary decor, far from boring.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, modern, clean
review.locationRemarks: A block from Market and Powell. Close to Muni.

review.title: Amazing hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was in an excellent location! The lobby was always busy with people having drinks, playing games in the game room and having dinner. The decor was outstanding - the frames in the room, the glasses chandelier, something you've never seen before. Staff was so helpful and courteous and SO polite !! Best hotel and would recommend it 100% to friends.

review.title: Great Decor and close to shopping
review.reviewText:
Super fun hotel lobby , good bar , close to shopping and food- try The Grove for lunch. All the staff were great , very friendly and didn't miss once with recommendations.
Down side was a little noisy room wise, could here the hallway chatter and ghe SOMA neighborhood is gritty at times. Lots of homeless folks amongst the retail spaces but easy to get too and walk anywhere.

review.title: New favorite hotel!
review.reviewText: This place is the epitome of trendy, artistic San Francisco style. The staff is amazing and the location is ideal and the rooms are amazing! New favorite hotel!

review.title: Cool Hotel + Great Location + Wonderful Staff!
review.reviewText:
My friend and I were visiting San Francisco for our birthdays, and stayed at Hotel Zetta this past week for 4 nights. We had such a great time, I will definitely stay here again the next time I visit! The central location is pretty much ideal, and the room was very contemporary, comfortable and clean. We loved having complimentary the Illy espresso to wake up to every day in our room. We also made full use of the concierge - they all recognized us by the end of our stay, as we had many special requests, but I didn't feel that they were annoyed. Bartenders at both the lobby bar and the neighboring restaurant The Cavalier were awesome as well.

The staff were all so friendly and helpful in providing transportation advice and directions, restaurant recommendations, holding our luggage at the beginning and end of our stay, and even arranged to have a rental car brought right to us with a 30 minute notice for a spur of the moment trip to Muir Woods one afternoon. Honestly everyone in the hotel was great; I've stayed at nicer hotels with terribly unfriendly staff and can appreciate good customer service.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was wonderful, the vibe was laid back and cool. Staff could not have been better.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a delay in check-in, we'd had a long flight and were disappointed that we had to wait almost an hour past the designated check-in time.
review.locationRemarks: Blue Bottle Coffee in Mint Square is a must! Chinatown is walking distance, go to the R&G lounge. Farallon is a must for nice seafood in Union Square.

review.title: modern hotel near Union Square and ACT Theater
review.reviewText: Excellent modern decor and art. Very pleasant lobby bar/sitting area. Efficient valet parking system ($50 + $7 tax per 24 hours). Good food at lobby restaurant (Cavalier). The room was nicely decorated and very clean, smallish, windows facing other windows about 20 feet away so needed to keep blinds closed which made the room a bit dark and gloomy. No full length mirror in room. The heating system blew a strong breeze across the bed and so both of us were a bit uncomfortable sleeping. The room was good for a business stay, less enjoyable for a romantic or pleasure visit.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent decor, good food in lobby restaurant, good location for Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Full length mirror in room. Better quality soap at sink. Easier wifi connection. Newspapers in lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance from Union Square, ACT, the Ferry Building, the Exploratorium, and much more.

review.title: Fun place to stay!
review.reviewText: This is a newly renovated hotel in the city that was a very cool place to stay. From the eyeglass chandelier to the floor of adult style games (shuffle board, pool, ping pong etc...)it was a very fun place to stay. The artwork is unusual and ecclectic, the staff was warm and friendly and the The Cavalier Restaurant had trendy, delicious cocktails and great food. Loved our stay there and would highly recommend to others.
review.locationRemarks: The Barbary Coast Trail starts across the street from the hotel. This is a fun, historical walk that I would recommend!

review.reviewText: Loved the artsy decor, quiet room, attentive staff and central location. Suggestions for improvement include: housekeeping in the room could be improved (smudges on glass countertops and leather bed, better vacuuming, and only one bathrobe), and the air conditioning was noisy and may need maintenance.

review.positiveRemarks: Fun Interior design.
review.negativeRemarks: Room 610 bathroom floor tile drainage slope was improperly executed. Casing water from shower to collect at a low spot away from drain.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near union square.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: Few steps from union sq., room is amazing, friendly staff

review.title: Courteous, helpful staff; clean rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Courteous, helpful staff, clean rooms, interesting art….loved the metal dog…..can you make a metal cat?
review.negativeRemarks: being able to turn off the lights while in bed….
review.locationRemarks: close to shopping, theater

review.title: New, modern and centrally located!
review.reviewText: The hotel is new, very nicely decorated with a vibe. What you would expect from a boutique hotel. The hotel stuff was excellent! I travel a lot around the world but this kind of hospitality is not seen often. Very comfortable beds and quiet rooms despite the fact that the hotel is centrally located, close to the shopping area and the financial district. Definitely worth it's price!
review.positiveRemarks: Decor.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant Service.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, Art, Business, Sightseeing. Center of San Francisco!

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Although we were only in this hotel for one night I am already planning my next trip to return there and stay longer. From the design to all the comforts available there is nothing bad I can say about this place. The location couldn't be any better, the restaurant was superb. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for fresh and modern.

review.title: Very hip, very nice.
review.reviewText:
We had a great time staying at Hotel Zetta. The repurposed decor and artwork are very modern, and the rooms clean and comfortable.The free wi-fi was great for searching maps and things to do around town, while the ipod docking station that played thru the flat screen tv was perfect for listening to music while chilling in the room. The staff was very helpful with restaurant recommendations, but not very good with directions to the airport. Odd. The Cavalier restaurant associated with the hotel has delicious food and the most wonderful cocktails we have ever had! Hotel Zetta is centrally located in the city and we had no problem leaving our car at the hotel and walking or taking the cable car everywhere we went in the city.

Our only complaint: We slept in late and did not leave the room until after 1:00pm and the room was not cleaned that day and the room service dishes from breakfast not picked up.

We would stay at Hotel Zetta again!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean modern decor, superb restaurant and bar.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk more helpful with directions. Be more conscientious about room cleaning.

review.title: Who hired these people?
review.reviewText:
First off I must say that I stay in hotels approximately two months a year for business so I know what to expect at a hotel.

Here's the good; the hotel is new and modern and has very comfortable beds and is in a great location next to the mall. The room was a good size and the very clean.

The Bad; The front counter staff are awful. Firstly I told the front counter staff that I was here for my wedding and I would like to request a room on a higher level. I was then told that there was only one room available on the 3rd floor and that's all they can do . He did mention that I should take a look at it then come back and upgrade my room to a bigger room on a higher floor. First of all this was a Wednesday night and the hotel was quiter then a library when we got there . Sooo up to the room I go just to look at a view of a brick wall 3 feet from my window . Now I'm starting to feel like I'm being suckered into upgrading my room to get to a higher floor I check online and there are all sorts of rooms available for that night . I feel like I was lied to because it was my wedding night and the front staff were looking for more money . No thanks hotel Zeta! I will vote with my money and go elsewhere. There are a lot of hotels in San Francisco and this place needs to smarten up. I stayed at the fairmont the next day and was very happy to be treated like a customer had a very pleasent stay.

review.title: Great location hotel - modern and fun
review.reviewText:
Fab location, clean, modern and cool hotel

- breakfast too expensive and not much choice
- bar is cool
- bed is comfy
- shower is exquisite
- chic design

review.title: Cool, up to date hotel with all you need
review.reviewText: Charging station for up to 10 devices; crisp, clean lines in the room; spacious shower with option of hand-held; large desk area; yummy illy coffee; great location. Will stay here again!

review.title: Great boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Very Chíc, cool hotel in Perfect location for shopping and walking Union square. Will come back for sure.

review.title: This is an amazing hotel!
review.reviewText:
This is an eco-friendly hotel, decorated with a fantastic imagination! Very warm and inviting, lots to explore. The employees bend over backwards to be helpful with suggestions for restaurants, things to see, suggestions on transportation.
Centrally located by the cable cars, Union Square, public transit.
We LOVED our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor. The employees. The rooms are very comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for tourism, 1/2 block from the cable cars, Union Square and public transit. Right next to an amazing mall, lots of local restaurants.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Location was perfect...right in the middle of the city...20 yards from nordstroms and the shopping center...rail cars and union station were right around the corner...great place

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Perfect - no issues! This a very modern setting in a vintage building. Quite and great place to stay.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location .. friendly staff... all around a very pleasurable experience.

review.title: Great City Stay
review.reviewText: Fun, creative, clean and perfectly located hotel in San Francisco.

review.title: Very impressed!
review.reviewText: My husband and I regularly come to San Francisco, and were both very happy to find a new place to stay. The staff was very welcoming and really went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. The room itself was very comfortable, stylish and clean. I loved the location! It's within walking distance of lots of shopping, Union Square, the BART, and great restaurants. It was nice to be able to walk to our favorite places without having to figure out parking each time. We did have a car and used the valet parking daily, and that's partly why I say the location is great. It's easy to get to by car, don't have to worry about finding a parking spot, and don't have to deal with the congestion of Union Square hotels which can be difficult to reach by car if you're not familiar with the streets. The $50 a day valet/parking fee is standard for the area, but the fast, free Wi-Fi helps make up for that. (Most hotels in the area charge for the parking and for Wi-Fi). All in all, a great experience. Kudos to the staff - they did great!!!

review.title: Hip place
review.reviewText: Nice brand new hotel. A little on the expensive side but I guess thats San Francisco. Staff was nice and hellpfull. Location is perfect and the games room was definitly a nice perk.

review.title: Hotel Zetta
review.reviewText: Funky hotel with a nice boutique feel suited for couples looking for a romantic getaway in the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor
review.negativeRemarks: No swimming pool
review.locationRemarks: Busy shopping district

review.title: Great hotel to see city
review.reviewText: Well situated to have easy access to main sites of San Francisco. Great playroom and lounge to escape from the city if it gets too much for you.
review.positiveRemarks: The playroom with shuffleboard and snooker tables.

review.title: Decent hotel -- but beware of flooding!
review.reviewText: We really liked the hotel, but we would have liked it more if the shower properly drained and didn't flood our room. We were forced to spend part of our romantic weekend getaway mopping up the floor - and hotel staff didn't even offer to compensate us in any way whatsoever for our trouble.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service

review.title: Modern, clean and fun!
review.reviewText: I stayed here with two friends for 3 nights, the staff here were beyond lovely, the gorgeous girls on the desk when we arrived (Ray I think one was called) were especially lovely and recommended bars for us to eat and drink. Anything you asked any of the staff was no bother and they all made us feel welcome. The rooms were spacious, modern and very clean. The lobby is amazing! (They have a wine hour at the bar). There is a lovely cafe across the road we had breakfast in every morning (not the one directly opposite) and the trams, cable cars and shops are within 200 metres of the hotel. We really loved it!

review.title: Center of Downtown
review.reviewText: Center of downtown, great for shopping and site seeing in SF. Very contemporary design!!! "Play Room" is a magnificent touch!!
review.positiveRemarks: Very contemporary, very Chic!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast can be a little more interesting.
review.locationRemarks: steps away from all the great things in SF

review.title: Brilliant hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel is in a perfect spot to explore the city. The rooms were spacious, tidy and quiet. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Internet is free in the lobby and on the room (for 24h). Computers in the lobby available to print boarding passes etc (free of charge).
Breakfast is only a few pastries and free coffee at the bar.
review.positiveRemarks: Room and interior
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly located to explore San Francisco

review.title: Very clean and modern
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was non-existent except for an awesome cappucino machine. The lack of breakfast was very disappointing, although I understand it is because the kitchen was undergoing renovation. I would have liked to see a discount or voucher to use at a nearby restaurant for breakfast. The location was great.
review.positiveRemarks: The new, clean, modern furnishings. The staff were very helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Include breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: close to shopping, within walking distance of more shopping and restaurants in Union Square.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Downtown locations and easy to walk to shops and BART

review.title: Great Hotel, Great location
review.reviewText:
This was a great hotel to stay at. It's fairly new and pretty chic. Art all over the hotel, and hotel rooms. There's even an area for shuffle board and pool. Complimentary wine is served on weekdays from 5pm-6pm.

The room was very spacious and clean. The furniture was also modern, comfortable, and it's right in the heart of Downtown. Great spot for shopping, and catching a cable car.

No complaints here!

review.title: Don't expect too much
review.reviewText: Inexperienced staff, modern renovations, easy access to public transportation; only worth staying with discounts; bring your own shower cap
review.positiveRemarks: Modern decor
review.negativeRemarks: Inexperience staff
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to everything

review.title: Outstanding place
review.reviewText: Wasn't sure what to expect from this hotel since the previous reviews were poor but let me tell you this place has it all!! Great location, just steps from Westfield shopping center and few blocks from Union Square. I totally loved the game room on the second floor, great for ending the day. Rooms were very nice furnished, bed and sheets were super comfortable and the staff was really friendly! The only negative thing I found about this place is that my bathroom door had a hole on it and that valet parking was really expensive. Other than that this hotel is great for couples and for families as well.
review.positiveRemarks: Game room
review.negativeRemarks: No restaurant yet and expensive valet parking fee
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location, large rooms for central San Francisco, and a reasonable price.

review.title: X
review.reviewText: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
review.positiveRemarks: Location.
review.negativeRemarks: Newly open, staff seems to have problem figuring how to run the hotel.

review.title: Decent
review.reviewText: Found mold in the shower but everything was nice. Good location. Nice and helpful staff. Overall decent.
review.negativeRemarks: Mold in shower
review.locationRemarks: Tough if driving in during rush hour but a decent location once your driving is over. Central to shops, trolley, taxi, etc

review.title: Everything is amazing except for the wifi
review.reviewText:
Everything at the hotel was perfect except for their wifi. Being a business travellor, a reliable wifi connection is key to stay connected with your work and more importantly, your family that you are so often away from.

It was very unfortunate that such an otherwise amazing hotel is now on my blacklist because they could not do anything to solve the poor connectivity issues during my 5 day stay. It seems like bad wifi is a systemic problem that won't get better unless the hotel makes a dedicated effort to upgrade what they have right now.
review.positiveRemarks: Very swanky design.
review.negativeRemarks: Terrible wifi.

review.title: Should have opened a month from now
review.reviewText:
The hotel was just opened a couple days prior and no one knew how to work the systems. We got there at 11 and couldn't be checked in until 4. Where they then couldn't figure out how the keys were made. They have me a key to a room, which was occupied. They gave me a key to another room, which was occupied. They gave me a key to another room and they came around a couple hours later and said they were re-keying the entire hotel.

Then the room smelled so badely of paint fumes, we had to open the window for air. But then the heater didn't work and it was freezing.

Everyone was very nice, but didn't seem to have an ounce of training.

review.title: Give them some time to work out the kinks.
review.reviewText: I guess they just opened but the hotel was not in working condition yet. Where to start.. we arrived to the hotel but could not yet check-in as they had to make sure our room was ok. After about 30-45 minutes of sitting in an empty lobby, we were able to get a room in this empty hotel. It's a bad sign when you get to your floor and see beds leaning in the hallway and signs on smoke detectors on our floor clearly marked as not working. Spoke to another guest who told us to be careful in the elevator as she was trapped for about 30 minutes earlier. The air conditioner/heater was not working in our first room on the fifth floor so we switched to a different room on same floor. We needed it because the room still smelled of plastic and fresh paint. Unfortunately the ac/heater did not vent the room much regardless, so we just had to deal with it. And the windows don't open or crack open which is fine. Then the water was turned off Saturday morning and mid-day several times so we didn't have water to shower. The lobby was clean but nothing was setup nor working. The bar dowstairs was not stocked nor open yet. Disappointed in this stay. 4 stars?? New hotel yes. 4 stars no. The worst part was that we had to pay for our stay here and they were not able to recognize the room and stay was sub-standard. -1 for poor customer service but at least they were trying to accomodate.
review.positiveRemarks: Fresh paint smell highlighted the new room
review.negativeRemarks: Fresh paint smell highlighted the new room
review.locationRemarks: Being next to shopping center was nice.
